translated: Bergvall, Erik Gustaf, director, Mjölby, born on 29/3/92 in Hults bruk, Åby, Kvillinge, Östergötland, son of factory owner G.F.B. and Emma Bonnevier. Married to Elsvig Carlsson in 1927, who passed away in 1947. Children: Karl-Gustaf born in 1928, Anna-Britta born in 1934. Bergvall attended Ljungstedtska technical vocational school in Linköping, Eberstein's technical school and technical high school in Norrköping. He traveled to Germany, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Switzerland, Italy, Denmark, and Norway several times. He served as manager of Mjölby foundry and mechanical workshop from 1913-1918 and as director of the factory (Primoverken) since 1918. He was a board member and vice-chairman of the Östergötland private bank's Mjölby branch, inspector for vocational schools in Mjölby, chairman of the Swedish foundry masters' association, auditor in its Norrköping department, auditor in the Älder-d association Mjölby department, representative for Allmänna brandstodsbol., member of church council and church board, lay judge and courthouse-building committee member in Folkungabygd district court, board member and treasurer in a labor association, board member in Mjölby's recognized hospital, and member of the aviation committee. He was a member of the Odd Fellows and Freemasonry. His hobbies were singing and music. He was a member of the Swedish singing association GM, Östergötland singing association GM, and Singing brothers GM.
